page.title: 01Morcombelake area
page.content: This South Western part of Dorset lies within a designated "Area of outstanding natural beauty." From rounded hills rising to 200 metres enfolding green valleys the views are spectacular. The population is sparse and scattered but in summer there are holiday visitors either staying within the area or passing through along the A.35 which cuts across the South West corner en route to Devon and Cornwall. Moreover many retired persons have in recent years, been attracted to the area to live there permanently. Apart from the A.35 road, communications in the district are notoriously difficult. The few roads are narrow and winding having steep hedges at either side.Overall it is a hilly pastoral scene with relatively mild climate and increasing notoriety.
